instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01987 20V 0Amp
threads.message:
Hi,
i have this board, I can't enter in DFU mode.
PPBUS_G3H = 12,31V
i have all SLP2R but I have all AWAKE (PP3V3_AWAKE)
is it normal?
thanks
Best regards

threads.title: 820-01987 20V 0Amp
threads.message:
If ALL AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages are present, machine should appear in DFU.
SSD voltages also required to complete restore.
Did you follow all the stepst from DFU tutorial?
Any history fault available?

threads.title: 820-01987 20V 0Amp
threads.message:
sorry I forget a word I have all awake except PP3V3_AWAKE.
PP3V3_AWAKE is It necessary to enter in DFU?
liquid (near U6903) I reball U6903 seems good
thanks

threads.title: 820-01987 20V 0Amp
threads.message:
3V3 AWAKE is also needed, of course.
Post diode mode to ground there.

threads.title: 820-01987 20V 0Amp
threads.message:
Then U7800 shoud be the culprit.
Do you get all other voltages from U7800 (SYM 1 OF 4)?

threads.title: 820-01987 20V 0Amp
threads.message:
PP3V3_G3H_PMU_VDDMAIN=3,32V
PP1V8_SLPS2R=1,8V
PP3V3_G3H_RTC=3,298V
PP1V1_SLPS2R=1,105V
PP3V3_G3H_PMU_VINRTC_R=3,3V

Output:
PP0V8_SLPS2R=0,803V
PP3V_G3H_RTC=3,01V
PMU_LDO3_OUT_R=1,802V
CPU_C10_GATE_L=0,01V
PP1V_S0SW=0,09V
PP3V3_G3H_PMU_VDDMAIN=3,32V
PP3V3_AWAKE=0,020V
PP3V3_S5=0V

is it liquid spill under U7800? I haven't remove the shield, how can I do? with hot airgun?
thanks

threads.title: 820-01987 20V 0Amp
threads.message:
If no short on 3V3_AWAKE, then U7800 has an internal problem, or broken solder.
Search on Youtube, if someone shows how to access that area.
Apply 138 degrees solder paste; it will help you a lot.
